WorkItem.ClosedComment: This issue should be fixed in the latest Client Profile Configuration Designer.
WorkItem.Description:
Hello, ClickOnceInstaller.exe seems to have an obvious problem, I'm using version 3.5.30606.0 which as far as I can tell is the one included in the latest release of the Configuration Designer, however the seemingly newer ClickOnceInstaller.exe version 3.5.30729.1 gotten from the PREVIEW release of the client profile installer off download.ms.com does not have this issue. 
 
On Vista 0x86 with 3.5SP1 get the following exception every time:
 
Could not load file or assembly 'ClickOnceInstaller, Version=3.5.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' or one of its dependencies. Strong name validation failed. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8013141A)
 
Should we be using the newer versioned ClickOnceInstaller.exe from the preview bootstrapper release? However the bootstrapper is the other way around, lower version number, larger file and seems to work better...
 
Any idea when the next update is coming to these tools?
Thank you.

Comments.Message: Please make sure that you have the latest Client Profile Configuration Designer. The issue you are seeing has been resolved in the latest package that is currently available for download.

OK sounds good, where is the latest package? Unfortuently it is not easy to find. Version 3.5.30606.0 is the latest release form what I can gather. Only place I can find it is http://www.codeplex.com/wpf/Release/ProjectReleases.aspx?ReleaseId=14962.

From your reply I can only assume neither of the version are the latest releases. Link?

Indeed, the latest version (release 14962) does indeed have the exception I reported. Please take a look again, it is not fixed! Also without explicit support for reboot survival, I would say the installer will fail its primary mission for possibly 50% of users, making it quite useless.
